storyInfo: After the Chernobog incident, the Doctor broods over the events of the last three, breakneck months. Caught between confusion and thought, the Doctor recalls an interesting story with a fallen friend.

attributes.content: I bet 300. It's just a pile of broken scrap metal. Not worth the trouble.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: You sure? I'll bet 500, then. That thing's important to us.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: How do you figure?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Intuition.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Not tricky to find old gadgets in the wastes, though, when Catastrophes blow them out all the time.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: But intuition tells me that's not your average trash.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: What are you two chatting about?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Oh, Doctor.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Good evening, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: We went to a drifter settlement yesterday while on field duty, and turned out something fairly interesting.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: It's just industrial scrap. I've seen this stuff all over the western wastes. Not worth your time, Doctor.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: But incredibly, it's industrial scrap that still works. It seems to be playing some kind of audio.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Music?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You'd be hard-pressed to convince me that's music.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: The circumstances it was found in?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: There was a strange machine in the middle of the drifters' settlement. Painted red, very heavy, and made strange noises when anyone came near.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The drifters weren't too keen on approaching it, but they still set up camp around it.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: We ought to have moved it back. Dame Kal'tsit might know the specifics of its technology.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Spend cash to drag back a pile of industrial scrap? Have we ever had the luxury?
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Perhaps that banshee might take a liking to it.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: If you have some personal beef going on, I suggest you don't bring it to work.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Sounds interesting.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Time permitting, we can visit that settlement together sometime. Maybe I'll be able to tell you what it is.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Oh, looks like our gamble's gonna pay off, then.
attributes.name: Ace

attributes.content: Then it's settled. Once Her Majesty's affairs are worked out for the time being, together we'll go.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: And keep to that deal.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: You awaken to an unpleasant mechanical noise.
A normal day.
Before your eyes is the ceiling of an ordinary living room in Rhodes Island. The furnishings look just as ordinary, though the hum of the ventilation system seems a bit deeper than in other cabins.
You know why. It is one of the most inconspicuous parts of your many peculiarities.
You wash up perfunctorily. This part isn't so different from ordinary people. You take special medication to maintain your condition. This part is a bit different from ordinary people.
Next, you don the full-body protective clothing that hampers your normal activities, but considering your physical condition, it is necessary. It may also be temporary, depending on your recovery.
These are all orders from Dr. Kal'tsit. According to her, you used to know more about these things than she did; but now, only she can look after your health.
Of course, Dr. {@nickname}. You are not like that one.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Is there anyone out there like us?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Is anyone out there like you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The world has not been kind to you, and you know this.
Ah, Doctor, you're awake.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Considering how late you stayed up, you can rest a bit longer.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Not going to urge me to work today?;...I'm fine.;Don't worry, I'm feeling pretty energetic.

attributes.content: Doctor... I'm not trying to supervise your work or anything. You should rest when it's time to rest.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Hmm... Dr. Kal'tsit says you need to be getting enough sleep, and that means more than usual.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Really...? Doctor, I'm worried you may be a little TOO energetic.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Oh, by the way, Dr. Kal'tsit stepped out for the day. She asked me to tell you that the meeting is postponed to tomorrow.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Huh. So in other words, there's nothing on today's schedule?;Do I actually get a day off?

attributes.content: Yes, that's why you should take advantage of it and rest up.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Resting up, huh...;......;What a luxurious word.

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Cafeteria
Oh, Doctor! Good morning.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ehh? Oh, Doctor~!
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.options: Good morning.

attributes.content: Wooow, Doctor, you actually got the time to come down to the cafeteria for breakfast today?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.options: Yes... I have the day off.;......;Am I normally that busy?

attributes.content: Heh, would you look at that.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I never see you in the cafeteria so early.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.options: What impression have I given you...?

attributes.content: What impression, huh... Probably a workaholic, chronically overworked all year round?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Seriously though, this is long overdue. You've been like this ever since we left Lungmen. Don't want to see you break down.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Be a little kinder to yourself, Doctor. After all, we were—
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: —Ouch... Gahhh, g'damn, the hell are you doing?!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Loose lips sink ships.
attributes.name: Yato

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.options: It's fine... You're exactly right.;My life is not solely my own, and I need to remind myself from time to time.

attributes.content: Oh, it's not that, Doctor. That's not what I meant...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Well, whatever. Enjoy your breakfast. I'll leave you in peace.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The operators gradually disperse, and you find yourself sitting in the corner of the canteen, a rare occurrence indeed.

Rhodes Island, a place that makes you feel both at home yet also estranged, just like those clear but also unrecognizable memories. A pharmaceutical company with the primary goal of resolving the problems surrounding the Infected.

It is said that the past you was intimately connected to all of this. It is said that you played a key role in its establishment. It is said that you were the brains of Rhodes Island, and that Rhodes Island was the extension of your will.
A portion of what was spoken of has been slowly returning to you, but you are not sure if this is good or bad.
You have forgotten too much. Rhodes Island has welcomed you, but you don't know if you are worthy of its welcome.
Your breakfast lies before your eyes, a bland but healthy meal. You know that this, too, is Kal'tsit's work.
Over the past three months, your life has been filled with these feelings—
Everything is so strange yet so nostalgic. Conceptually, these feelings are completely contradictory, yet they manifest in front of you together.
Three months ago, during the sudden outbreak of rioting and conflict, they... Rhodes Island, rescued you from the epicenter of the turmoil.
In the ensuing conflict, too many people lost their lives.
So many of the deceased recognized you, yet you do not recognize them; So many of the deceased heard about you, yet you have not heard about them.
You gave your utmost, gaining greater respect in the process, and your hard work finally bore the fruit of victory. Yet that victory still came laden with inevitable pain.
Up until now... Up until now, you've had but one question, a question that you've repeatedly raised to yourself but have never been able to answer.
Is it all worth it?
Rhodes Island Integrated Bioprocessing Unit
Stretching out before your eyes is the most unique warehouse in all of Rhodes Island.
A large number of unclaimed objects are stacked in this warehouse.
A petite Perro operator is struggling to wipe down a badly-damaged shield.
You recognize the shield, and remember the former owner of that shield.
You remember that tall, somewhat slovenly operator who always sported a hearty smile. He was once your friend, or so you've been told. But you don't know anything.
You're weary of this repetitive, contradictory nonsense, but nothing better encapsulates the current state of your existence.
All the specifics sift through the cracks of your fingers. You extend your hand to catch them, but the fine sands of memory are dragged down by gravity and fall into the abyss, grain by grain.
D-Doctor?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: How'd you end up over her...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: This is... Ace's shield.

attributes.content: Yes. It belonged to him. Every week, I come by... to keep it clean.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Ugh, it's... so heavy.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Um, can you lend me a hand, Doctor? It's really, really heavy... I always have trouble lifting it back onto the shelf.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: You step forward to help her, but soon realize that you are too weak to lift the shield even a single centimeter off the ground.
Perhaps you were able to do it in the past, but such a task is no longer possible for your convalescing body. Kal'tsit has reminded you of this, as well as everything else.
Hey! Heyyyy! Doctor, don't lift with your back!
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Um, never mind. I can do it myself.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: Sorry, I'm no help at all.;But... this is Ace's shield. I should at least...

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. They always said you're the smartest person on Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: Let me help.

attributes.content: Alright! Just like this though— and be careful!
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Phew! We did it!
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: By the way, who are 'they?'

attributes.content: Let's see, Instructor Dobermann and others used to say that, as well as the elite operators.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Including Ace...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: He used to talk about you. He said that you could stand up to half an army by yourself, hahaha.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: Were you and Ace close?

attributes.content: Huh? Um... were we close...?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Ace was close to everyone. That's the kind of person he was.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: The very reliable type... During training, he taught us all sorts of things, fighting as a team, cooperation, breaking encirclement.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: The elite operators are always busy, but Ace took the time to drop by the training grounds.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: I always thought to myself, when could I become as reliable as Ace...?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Beagle stares at the shield with a sad smile. The dust from the warehouse plaster her hair and face, but the Perro operator doesn't seem to care.
You look around the room, and in the corner of the shelf, something catches your attention.
Various photos and ornaments stacked in a small, messy box. Underneath it are some old, faded documents.

attributes.options: This is...

attributes.content: Oh... That's....
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Doctor, you shouldn't...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: What is it?

attributes.content: These are... things that belonged to... they're from the Reunion fighters, back in Lungmen...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: The handlers in the Processing Room were discussing what to do with these for a long time, and ended up stuffing everything in here.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: You flip through a few photos. These old, yellowed, stained photos almost all depict Ursus people.
Most of the people in the photos are clad in ragged clothes, showing a mix of awkwardness, joy, or numbness when facing the camera.
On the backside of a silver pendant in the box is an engraving in the Ursus script—
—'To Ivana, my darling daughter. May she always know happiness.'
Among them are former enemies, as well as former friends.
You know that some of them fought against Rhodes Island to the bitter end, and you also know that some of them became allies of Rhodes Island in a time of crisis.
You don't know all their stories, but you do know the suffering of the Infected. You know... and yet you do not know.
Sometimes, those of us who were there, will also ask ourselves this question......
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: All of us have been through disaster. Ursus, the Infected, as well as us, but...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Was all of this truly worth it?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Ah, sorry. I, I shouldn't be venting my frustration... But every time I come here, and see these things...
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: A-Anyways, please forget I said anything, Doctor— Doctor?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.options: It's fine, don't worry about it.

attributes.content: Ah, it's already three! Gotta head to the training grounds. If I'm late, Instructor Dobermann's gonna chew me out again.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Gotta go, Doctor! Remember to lock the door, okay?
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: The Perro operator rushes out, leaving you alone with the ownerless objects stacked in the warehouse, save the slowly-settling dust of time.
You are about to turn and leave, but a strange red shadow enters your field of vision. Curious, but just not enough to stop your movement.
It's just a strange red machine.
3:53 P.M. \ Overcast
Rhodes Island Landship, Lower Deck
Real talk, don't you guys get hot in here all day? Not even thinking about heading up to catch some fresh air?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: This heat is just right for us Goliaths. Besides, someone's gotta keep an eye on this equipment.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Rhodes Island depends on the power system here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Whatever keeps your motor running.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Getting ready to leave?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Yup, there's nothing for me here, plus that old hag Kal'tsit's giving me the evil eye again.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'm actually really surprised that Dame Kal'tsit even let you back on.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Hah. Do you have any idea how many swords the hag has hanging over my head right now?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: More than you could ever... Oi, look at the corridor over there. Wanna guess who's standing in that corner?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: ...Are you going to Victoria?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Guess so. Just had a few words for my dear old pals before I go.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: We all know what you're trying to do. We also know we can't talk you out of it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: But I have to say it one more time. Going to Victoria is not a good idea, W.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: I think Sarkaz maybe shouldn't...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Ah, whatever. I'm just a boiler worker, and I shouldn't even be saying this stuff to you. Forget I brought it up.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: There is something I've wanted to ask... Most of the gang already left, so why are you staying behind?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: With your skills, don't you think you could make a good living anywhere?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Her Majesty left us this home. No reason we should leave it.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Having a place we belong to sure as hell beats wandering the wastes.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Besides...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: The burly Sarkaz knocks on the nearby machine.
We have to protect the things Her Majesty left behind. I guess it's not much different from what you're trying to do... And you know that, W, better than anyone else.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Protecting a boiler? That big ol' hunk of steamy machinery is your home, huh?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Basically, yeah. I'd say this boiler is my purpose in life. Laugh if you want.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Yeah, you know this isn't exactly a laughing situation.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Haha. You're still thinking of us, and we appreciate that.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Safe travels.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Ugh... saps.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It's time to go.
A voice from the shadows. W looks up, and though the light isn't on, someone has been staring at her from the darkness since the beginning.
I know, I know... Ascalon, you're the most impatient one of all, aren't you?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: But you're really not gonna let me see that 'Doctor' or the dragon lady? There's a loooot— that I still want to say to them—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Aww, giving me the cold shoulder?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: So, Ines is still alive? What's the situation in Londinium?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Then what's the plan? You used to be with Theresis—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Haha, fine. Spooking me with the silent treatment isn't easy. You used to be a lot more talkative. I guess seeing me pissed you off? I'll leave then, happy?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: It just so happens that I had some stuff to check with the old hag first, otherwise I wouldn't have wanted to be here either.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: We work together for now.
Work together, huh? I'm not sure I'd call it that. It's more like making sure I've got all my targets nice and clear before we meet up out there in a warzone later.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'm not gonna randomly stroll into Rhodes Island, don't worry. Though, those folks sure have an interesting look in their eyes. It's a warrior's look, you see it in battle—
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: The Sarkaz in the shadows does not answer.
W knows of this habit, in Ascalon's line of work. The rule is, each extra word makes your head hit the ground a little bit faster.
My dear sweet Ascalon, you're not my boss anymore.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: See you in Londinium.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: What's wrong, W? You haven't left yet? Huh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: That's weird. How come there's nobody here?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Rhodes Island Landship, Lower Deck
The roar of machinery fills the lowest level of Rhodes Island, the area that provides power to the entire ship.
The Sarkaz Goliaths are the operators responsible for running it. On weekdays, the bottom level is populated pretty exclusively by technical staff.
You are wandering around aimlessly.
In these three months, you still have not set foot in every corner of Rhodes Island.
Rhodes Island is like a small nomadic city. Though much smaller in scale, it is still well-equipped.
Its internal structure is far more complicated than it seems at a glance, and the power plant is one such example.
Hm? Why's it so lively here today? Nobody ever comes down to a place like... Oh...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Doctor?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: Closure told me you were looking for me?;Someone from HR said you were looking for me?

attributes.content: Yes, that's right. Actually... Uh, I've been wanting to talk to you for a while.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: But you didn't need to come down here in person. I'm drenched in sweat, and it's way too hot here for you...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Why don't take this somewhere else? How does that sound?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: No problem, but what did you need me for?;......;Sure, but what's the rush?

attributes.content: It's just... about some nostalgic stuff. Sorry to make you listen to my rambling.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: The burly Sarkaz man puts down the wrench in his hand and removes his dirty work gloves.
From the bottom of his toolbox, he takes out a small teapot and the accompanying teacups, contrasting sharply with his large, rough hands.
Do you drink tea?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: We can skip the formalities...;Am I the one bothering you?

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. You're here, I might as well take a break.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: I'll be glad to have some then.

attributes.content: You... Haha, I won't try to hide it. In fact, I never thought I'd get a chance to chat with you like this.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Seems like you're in a bad mood. Is something wrong? Something to do with the weather?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: He knows more about Rhodes Island than you.
You suddenly feel that it is this Sarkaz and his fellow workers who are keeping Rhodes Island going.
They grasp the lifeblood of the landship in their hands, yet they deliberately avoid the public eye.
You are grateful for everything they do, but don't know why.
It's hard to see the weather when we're working down here. Even through the lower windows, all you can see is the dust kicked up by the treads.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: I don't know what complex problems you're mulling over, Doctor. I'm just a simple boiler worker.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: I'm not exactly the big brain type over here.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: You have something you want to tell me.;Speak your mind. Maybe I should spend more time talking with everyone.

attributes.content: Yes, Doctor. Miss Amiya and Dame Kal'tsit are always ready to help you, so you should probably start with them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: There are too many things... and bottling them all up isn't a good option.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: Some things are hard to talk about... but you seem to know a lot.
How long have you worked for Rhodes Island?

attributes.content: I'm an old Rhodes Island hand, Doctor. We used to know each other. I took orders from you a few times before I started my technical work, even if you don't remember.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: The only advice I can give you is this: if they can't be the ones to answer you, who else can you ask to give you that answer?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: (Whispers) You are the ones She put her trust in... She trusted in you, and She trusted in them.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: Looking for an answer... huh?

attributes.content: In fact, I just saw W.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.options: Huh... is she here?;......;That's strange. Kal'tsit lets her around Rhodes Island?

attributes.content: Doctor, you must know by now, but W and Rhodes Island have a connection... and you're mixed up in that too.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: When a Sarkaz like Flamebringer showed up at Rhodes Island, I knew this day would come.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: It's something. From Kazdel to Ursus, then to Lungmen, and onto us here today, and even on into the future...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: We've kept moving forward, but we keep bumping into the same faces we started this journey with. Only now, they bring some of those far-reaching effects they left behind...
attributes.name: Sarkaz Boiler Worker

attributes.content: Doctor, you're back?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I haven't seen you all day... Where have you been?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Just wandering around the island.

attributes.content: It's fine. Getting enough rest is also a part of your job.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: I feel kind of listless, going a whole day without work.

attributes.content: Doctor...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I'll tell you a little secret, but don't let Dr. Kal'tsit know.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The truth is, Dr. Kal'tsit didn't have anything that important to do today. She didn't need to go out.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: She's seen how tired you've been lately and wanted you to take a break.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Oh.

attributes.content: But, you look pretty happy? Did something good happen?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Nothing in particular. It's just been a long time since I've talked to people like this.
By the way, Amiya...
I think I saw something strange in the operators' storage room.

attributes.content: Storage room... Doctor, did you... What do you mean by something strange?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: It was red...;Like some kind of industrial device...

attributes.content: Oh, you're probably talking about that 'red industrial scrap.'
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You might not remember, but... it was a bet between Scout and Ace. One day, they brought that device back to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Closure spent some time on it and decided it was useless, so she let it sit there in the warehouse.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Can I go take another look at it?

attributes.content: Oh, of course.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Among the various discarded, unused mechanical equipment in the warehouse, that strange device towers above the rest.
The box-shaped device stands more than two meters tall. The red paint on the surface is clearly visible, but has been severely worn down under the perennial erosion of wind and sand.
It's this thing. You're weird, Doctor. Why the sudden interest?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: When they first brought it back, the box would make noises as soon as someone got close to it, but I think Closure broke it.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: What do you mean I broke it?! It was already like this when I moved it back here. All I did was 'study' it a little.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I've never been able to figure out what this thing is really for. Originally wanted to see if I could open it up, but ended up breaking three power saws without a crack.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: So, yeah... Doctor, do you have any idea what this is?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.options: Maybe it's some kind of safe?;...Not sure.;Do you reckon it can fly?

attributes.content: A safe this big and conspicuously colored? Maybe if you really wanted to attract thieves, I guess?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Welp, even the Doctor doesn't know what it is.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: ...Doctor, are you okay? All that work finally rotting your brain?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: You observe the enigmatic device carefully. There are no buttons and no gaps under its worn-out metal casing.
You haven't seen anything like it before. At least in your existing memory, you have no impression of it.
You lightly knock on the casing of the device, out of curiosity.
Huh?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: D-Doctor! Watch out!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: D-Did anything happen?

attributes.content: Don't worry about that right now, just stand back!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: After a violent rattling noise, the device lets out a small 'ding.'
The complete, box-like structure suddenly opens, the once seamlessly-shut outer shell sliding up and down like a cabin door.
Inside the box-like structure, you see an artifact with a metallic luster.
Unlike the wear and tear that the outside of the box had been subjected to, everything inside is as smooth as ever, with no trace of the passage of time.
However, the manmade object within fills everyone with a sense of familiarity.
This is...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: A bottle... of beer... right?
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.options: No matter how you look at it, it's just a bottle of beer?

attributes.content: What the heck! I thought there'd be something super high-tech in it! Something a bit more constructive!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: After all that time, it turns out it's just a vending machine? What's the point of making something this tough anyway? You need it to withstand an originium bomb?!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Ugh... But, isn't that kind of a weird color for beer? I'll have to look into it some more...
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Doctor, do you know what this is?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Nothing. Just a heap of scrap metal.
What really matters is we got ourselves an extra bottle of beer.
But Closure, this beer...
Just put it in the room, next to Ace's shield.
Wasn't that the bet?
